Name: Matthis
Description: A miner‑turned‑custodian of the dead at the Death Guild. Earnest hardworking quietly thoughtful. Struggles with guilt and morality after unwittingly consuming the life of an injured wizard and gaining supernatural abilities. He reluctantly tries to use his influence without domination.

Name: Bartholomew
Description: Seasoned miner‑wizard who works alongside the Death Guild to secure and neutralize undead. Practical slightly amused by the world’s horrors; a stabilizing presence. Finds and shows Matthis the stone that enhances control and later becomes a small source of magical insight. Name origin: A traditional English name appearing in late‑16th century lists that gives it a grounded common feel.

Name: Elspeth
Role: Town baker and secretly a witch
Description: Warm resilient naturally empathetic. Brings light into the grim mining town with her kindness and subtle enchantments in baking. Her magic is gentle and mostly subconscious — unlike Matthis’ emerging curse it flows into mundane things (like bread) to make life steadier. Her affection for Matthis unintentionally exposes his hunger.

Name: Godric
Description: Unassuming and steady. A common laborer who discovers unexpected confidence and skill under gentle guidance. Matthis helps him unlock latent ability tied to witchcraft — channeling magical flow from objects into tools. Name origin: A name consistent with medieval and Renaissance English usage that blends unpretentiousness with quiet strength.

Name: Liora
Description: A frightened child whose uncontrolled magic has catastrophic effects. She becomes the first major ethical dilemma for Matthis that forces him to balance compassion with responsibility. Her condition exemplifies the danger of raw unchanneled magical flow.

Name: Corven
Role: Guild Master of the Death Guild
Description: Authoritative cautious and deeply wary of Matthis after his unusual connection to the undead. Obsessed with order and safety he initially reprimands Matthis for reckless behavior but gradually comes to recognize his potential. Corven embodies the tension between bureaucracy and the unpredictable nature of magical humans.
